content: Brastorne is a Botswana-based technology company founded in 2013. We are dedicated to bridging the digital divide across Africa by transforming simple feature phones into powerful, internet-enabled tools using USSD and SMS technology. Our mission is to connect the 760 million Africans who lack meaningful access to the digital world. Our vision is to 'Connect the Unconnected to the World.' We currently serve over 5.3 million users in Botswana, DRC, Cameroon, Guinea, and Zambia.
key_facts: Headquarters: Gaborone International Finance Park, Botswana
Core Tech: USSD and SMS based services

content: Brastorne is led by a team of visionary founders and executives: Martin Stimela (Co-founder & CEO), Naledi Magowe (Co-founder, Chief Growth Officer, and CMO), and Hankusa Hakoola (CFO). The team consists of 28 passionate individuals committed to innovation and digital equity in Africa.

description: mAgri is a mobile ecosystem that empowers small-scale farmers. It provides real-time market prices, localized weather forecasts, and expert agricultural advice via USSD (*157#) and SMS. Farmers can list produce for sale, connecting directly with buyers, which has led to a 250% increase in yields for some users.

Mpotsa (meaning 'Ask me') is the 'Google for feature phones.' It is an SMS-based Q&A service providing localized information on health, legal advice, job opportunities, and general knowledge. It allows users without internet access to get verified answers instantly via *152# or SMS.

Vuka is a text-based social networking service designed for users even on 2G/3G networks. Via *156#, users can create profiles, form community groups, chat with friends, and broadcast messages without needing a data plan or smartphone.

content: Brastorne is globally recognized for its impact. Our achievements include being an MIT Solver (2021), receiving the HP Advancing Digital Equity award (2021), being a Google Black Founders Fund Alumnus (2022), and winning the Heifer International & MIT AYuTe Africa Challenge (2022). We also received the SAIS Female Founder Award in 2025.
Mission: To connect the 760 million Africans lacking digital access. Vision: To connect the Unconnected to the world. Core Values: Impact, Boldness, Integrity, Innovation, and Grit.
